tasks.title: Create bear sprite image file
tasks.body:
Create a new bear sprite image file (`Urso.gif` or `UrsoPardo.gif`) following the existing wolf sprite patterns:

**Requirements:**
- 30x30 pixel sprite dimensions
- Two rows: top row with idle/standing frame, bottom row with 4 walking animation frames
- Pixel art style matching the existing wolf sprites
- Brown/dark brown color scheme appropriate for a bear
- Place in `src/Imagens/` directory

**Reference:**
- Study existing `LoboCinza.gif` and `LoboVermelho.gif` for sprite layout
- Bear should look more robust/larger than wolves but fit same 30x30 dimensions
- Look up pixel art bear references online for inspiration

**Success Criteria:**
- [ ] Sprite file created with correct dimensions
- [ ] Contains idle frame (top row) and 4 walking frames (bottom row)
- [ ] Matches visual style of existing enemies
- [ ] Placed in correct directory

tasks.title: Create Urso (Bear) enemy class
tasks.body:
Create a new `Urso.java` class in `src/ObjetosDoMapa/` following the wolf enemy implementation patterns:

**Requirements:**
- Extend the `Inimigo` base class
- Higher health than wolves (suggested: 8-10 HP vs wolf's 3-6 HP)
- Slower movement speed than wolves (suggested: 0.6 vs wolf's 0.8-1.3)
- Same damage output as wolves (1 HP)
- Load the bear sprite and set up animation frames
- Follow same collision detection and AI movement patterns

**Implementation Details:**
- Use `LoboCinza.java` as template for structure
- Set `vida = maxVida = 8` (or 10) for higher health
- Set `velMovimento = velMaxMovimento = 0.6` for slower speed
- Load sprite from `/Imagens/Urso.gif` (or whatever filename used)
- Set up `spriteParado` and `spriteAndando` arrays
- Use same explosion sprite for death animation

**Success Criteria:**
- [ ] Class extends Inimigo properly
- [ ] Has higher health and slower speed than wolves
- [ ] Sprite loading and animation setup works
- [ ] Movement and collision detection functional

tasks.title: Import Urso class in Estado_Level1
tasks.body:
Add the necessary import statement for the new Urso class in the Level 1 state manager:

**Requirements:**
- Add `import ObjetosDoMapa.Urso;` to the imports section
- Place it alongside existing wolf imports (`LoboCinza`, `LoboVermelho`)

**File to modify:**
- `src/GerenciadorDeEstados/Estado_Level1.java`

**Success Criteria:**
- [ ] Import statement added correctly
- [ ] No compilation errors

tasks.title: Add bear instance to Level 1 near the ending portal
tasks.body:
Add one bear enemy instance to the end of Level 1, positioned close to the ending portal:

**Requirements:**
- Add bear instance in the `inicializa()` method of `Estado_Level1.java`
- Position it near the portal at (4875, 165) - suggest around x=4800-4850
- Follow the same instantiation pattern as existing wolves
- Add to the `inimigos` ArrayList

**Implementation:**
```java
// Add near the end of enemy initialization
Inimigo urso = new Urso(mb);
urso.mudarPosicaoPara(4820, 170); // Near portal but not blocking it
inimigos.add(urso);
```

**Positioning considerations:**
- Portal is at (4875, 165)
- Place bear at ground level (y=170) 
- Give some space from portal (x=4820 suggested)
- Should be challenging final enemy before level completion

**Success Criteria:**
- [ ] Bear instance created and positioned correctly
- [ ] Added to enemies list
- [ ] Positioned near but not blocking the portal
- [ ] Game runs without errors
